scour.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to search very carefully and thoroughly through an area, a document etc
scour.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Her family began to scour the countryside for a suitable house.
scour.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to clean something very thoroughly by rubbing it with a rough material
scour.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Ada was scouring out the pans.
scour.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to form a hole by continuous movement over a long period
scour.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Over the years, the stream had scoured out a round pool in the rock.
